Umineko Project (UP): I didn't have a clue whether he was confused because he couldn't remember, or whether he was confused because he had seen something terrifying, and couldn't accept it.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't have a clue whether he was confused because he couldn't remember, or whether he was confused because he had seen something terrifying, and couldn't accept it.

Umineko Project (UP): ...If we interpreted what they were saying favorably, ......it meant that Auntie Rosa's conclusion had been correct from the beginning.

PC Japanese (JP): …彼らの言っていることを、好意的に解釈すると、……それは楼座叔母さんが最初に断じているのと同じ意味になる。

Umineko Project (UP): Kanon‐kun had appeared from the back door in the kitchen with a serious injury.{n}Then he had been taken to the servant room and cared for.
Steam (ST): Kanon had appeared near the back door to the kitchen with a serious injury. Then, he had been taken to the servant room and cared for.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon had appeared from the back door in the kitchen with a serious injury. Then he had been taken to the servant room and cared for.
PC Japanese (JP): 厨房の勝手口に大怪我をした嘉音くんが現れた。そして使用人室に運び手当てした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 厨房の勝手口に大怪我をした嘉音くんが現れた。{n}そして使用人室に運び手当てした。
Russian (RU): Канон появился на кухне с чёрного входа с серьёзной раной.{n}Затем его отнесли в комнату прислуги, где ему оказали помощь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Kanon‐kun apareceu na porta dos fundos da cozinha com uma grave ferida.{n}Então ele foi levado até a sala dos serviçais e tratado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 受了重傷的嘉音君，出現在了廚房的後門。{n}接著，他被搬到了傭人室接受了治療。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 受了重伤的嘉音君，出现在了厨房的后门。{n}接着，他被搬到了佣人室接受了治疗。
Italian (IT): Kanon era comparso alla porta di servizio della cucina con una grave ferita.{n}Venne portato nella stanza per i domestici, dove poi ricevette delle cure...
Turkish (TR): Kanon-kun mutfağın arka kapısında ciddi bir yarayla ortaya çıkmıştı.{n}Daha sonra hizmetkâr odasına götürülmüştü ve ilk yardım yapılmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Then, something terrifying had happened.
Steam (ST): ...And after that, something terrifying had happened.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、恐ろしい何かが起こった。
Russian (RU): ......А потом случилось нечто ужасное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E algo terrível aconteceu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然後，發生了某種可怕的事情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然后，发生了某种可怕的事情。
Italian (IT): Dopodiché, avvenne qualcosa di spaventoso.
Turkish (TR): ......Daha sonra, korkunç bir şey oldu.

Umineko Project (UP): Since these people couldn't imagine that Kanon‐kun could have pulled that off, they had started to suspect whether that really had been Kanon‐kun. Is that how things are?
Steam (ST): So, were these people so convinced that Kanon-kun couldn't possibly have done such a thing... that they'd started to suspect whether it had even been Kanon-kun at all?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since these people couldn't imagine that Kanon-kun could have pulled it off, they had started to suspect whether that really had been Kanon-kun. Is that how things are?
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音くんがそんなことをしてのけるとは想像できなくて、あれが本当に嘉音くんだったのか疑わしくなった。というところなのか。
Russian (RU): Поскольку эти люди не могли себе представить, что Канон‐кун может быть способен на такое, у них появились сомнения, был ли это на самом деле Канон‐кун. Вот как всё складывается?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como eles não conseguiam imaginar como o Kanon‐kun poderia ter feito aquilo, eles começaram a suspeitar se realmente havia sido o Kanon‐kun. Então é assim?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於無法想像嘉音君會做出這種事，所以那人究竟是不是嘉音，就變得可疑了起來。……是這麼一回事麼？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于无法想象嘉音君会做出这种事，所以那人究竟是不是嘉音，就变得可疑了起来。……是这么一回事么？
Italian (IT): Queste persone non riuscivano a concepire che Kanon-kun potesse compiere un atto del genere, ed erano arrivati a chiedersi se fosse stato davvero lui. È così che stavano le cose?
Turkish (TR): Bu insanlar Kanon-kun'un bunu yapabileceğini hayal dahi edemedikleri için, bunun gerçekten Kanon-kun olup olmadığından şüphelenmeye başlamışlardı. Durum bu mu?

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, this meant......Kanon‐kun had appeared.{n}No matter how confused they were, no matter how they muddled their words, that's what it meant in the end.
Steam (ST): In other words, that means...Kanon-kun did appear. No matter how confused they are, no matter how they muddle their words, that's what it means in the end.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, this means, ......Kanon-kun had appeared. No matter how confused they were, no matter how they muddled their words, that's what it meant in the end.
PC Japanese (JP): つまりそれは、……嘉音くんが現れたということだ。彼らがどんなに混乱し、言葉を濁そうとも、つまりはそういうことになる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): つまりそれは、……嘉音くんが現れたということだ。{n}彼らがどんなに混乱し、言葉を濁そうとも、つまりはそういうことになる。
Russian (RU): Другими словами, это означает... Канон‐кун объявился.{n}Независимо от того, насколько озадачены они были, насколько сумбурны были их слова, вот что получалось в итоге.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, isso significa......que o Kanon‐kun havia aparecido.{n}Não importa o quão confusos eles tenham ficado, não importa o quão embaralhadas estejam as palavras deles, no final, é isso que significa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總之這就是說，……嘉音君出現了。{n}不管他們情緒有多亂，有多含糊其辭，總結起來就是如此。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总之这就是说，……嘉音君出现了。{n}不管他们情绪有多乱，有多含糊其辞，总结起来就是如此。
Italian (IT): In altre parole, questo voleva dire... che era apparso Kanon-kun.{n}Quanto fossero confusi o vaghi nei loro discorsi contava poco, era questo ciò che volevano dire.
Turkish (TR): Başka bir deyişle, bu......Kanon-kun'un ortaya çıktığı anlamına geliyordu.{n}Kafaları ne kadar karışık olursa olsun, kelimeleri ne kadar dolandırırsa dolandırsınlar, bunun anlamı sonuç olarak buydu.

Umineko Project (UP): So had Kanon‐kun indeed used some trick to escape that room while it was locked?! No, that doesn't matter anymore.
Steam (ST): So, does that mean that, after all, Kanon-kun used some trick to escape that room even though it was locked?! No, that doesn't matter anymore.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So just as Rosa oba-san thought, Kanon-kun had used some trick to escape that room while it was locked?! No, that doesn't matter anymore.
PC Japanese (JP): やはり嘉音くんがあの部屋を施錠したまま抜け出すトリックがあるということなのか？！　いや、今そんなことはどうでもいい。
Russian (RU): Так что, как и думала тётя Роза, Канон‐кун нашёл способ выбраться из той комнаты, пока она была заперта?! Нет, это больше не имело значения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então o Kanon‐kun usou mesmo algum truque para escapar daquele quarto que estava trancado?! Não, isso não importa mais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 果然這代表著，嘉音君是有方法從那間上了鎖的房間裡金蟬脫殻的嗎？！不，現如今這種事根本無所謂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 果然这代表着，嘉音君是有方法从那间上了锁的房间里金蝉脱壳的吗？！不，现如今这种事根本无所谓。
Italian (IT): Quindi, dopotutto Kanon-kun aveva impiegato un trucco per scappare da quella stanza rimasta chiusa a chiave?! No, in quel momento non aveva importanza.
Turkish (TR): Yani Kanon-kun gerçekten de kilitli olduğu halde odadan kaçmak için bir yöntem mi kullanmıştı?! Hayır, artık bunun bir önemi yok.

Steam (ST): The real problem is that Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa-san were killed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The real problem is that Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa-san were killed.

Steam (ST): Aunt Rosa has claimed that Kanon-kun was behind this from the very beginning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa oba-san had claimed that Kanon-kun was behind this from the very beginning.

Russian (RU): Тётя Роза утверждала, что Канон‐кун стоял за всем этим с самого начала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Rosa afirmou que o Kanon‐kun estava por trás disso desde o começo.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座姑母从一开始就断定了这是嘉音君的所为。

Umineko Project (UP): No matter how confused they became and no matter how much they tried to deny it, ...they were halfway saying that it was the truth.
Steam (ST): No matter how confused these people are, no matter how much they try to deny it, ...they're halfway confirming that she was right.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter how confused they became and no matter how much they tried to deny it, ...they were halfway saying that it was the truth.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らがどう混乱してそれを否定しようとしても、…彼らは半ばそうだと言っている。
Russian (RU): Независимо от того, насколько они были запутаны, и независимо от того, сколько раз они пытались это отрицать... Они на полуслове подтвердили, что это была правда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa o quão confuso eles tenham ficado e não importa o quanto eles tentem negar, ...eles estavam parcialmente dizendo a verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 無論他們怎麼亂作一團，怎麼否定這個見解，…他們所說的話，也有一半是認同了這一點的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 无论他们怎么乱作一团，怎么否定这个见解，…他们所说的话，也有一半是认同了这一点的。
Italian (IT): Per quanto fossero confusi e per quanto cercassero di negarlo... stavano dicendo che era in parte la verità...
Turkish (TR): Kafaları ne kadar karışmış olursa olsun ve bunu ne kadar inkâr etmeye çalışırlarsa çalışsınlar, ...yarı yarıya gerçeğin bu olduğunu söylüyorlardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......But even so, for some reason, I felt like their awkwardness couldn't be explained just by confusion...
Steam (ST): ...But even so, for some reason, I felt like their awkwardness couldn't be explained by confusion alone...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかしそれでも、なぜか彼らの歯切れの悪さは、混乱だけでは説明ができないような気もした…。
Russian (RU): ......Но даже так, по какой то причине я чувствовал, что их смущение нельзя объяснить одной лишь путаницей...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mesmo assim, por algum motivo, eu sinto que a estranheza deles não poderia ser explicada apenas como uma confusão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過即便如此，我也還是莫名地覺得，並不能光以大腦一片混亂，來解釋他們這副吞吞吐吐的樣子…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过即便如此，我也还是莫名地觉得，并不能光以大脑一片混乱，来解释他们这副吞吞吐吐的样子…。
Italian (IT): A dispetto di ciò, per qualche ragione sentivo che la loro evasività non poteva essere spiegata unicamente dalla confusione...
Turkish (TR): ......Ama yine de, nedense, onların bu garipliklerinin sadece kafa karışıklığıyla açıklanamayacağını hissettim...

Steam (ST): ...What did they see?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......What had they seen?

Italian (IT): Cos'è che avevano visto?
Turkish (TR): ......Ne görmüşlerdi?

Umineko Project (UP): Like they said, had they really {i:seen something unexplainable with words}...?
Steam (ST): Like they said, did they really {i:see something that couldn't be explained with words}...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Like they said, had they really seen something unexplainable with words...?

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como disseram, eles realmente {i:viram algo que não se pode explicar com palavras}...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真是如他們所說，{i:看到了無法用言語說明的什麼嗎}…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真是如他们所说，{i:看到了无法用言语说明的什么吗}…？

Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Rosa, having decided that she wouldn't be able to get any more out of them, concluded her questioning, and said that she wanted to check the two bodies.
Steam (ST): Aunt Rosa, who'd decided that further talk wouldn't get us anywhere, concluded her questioning and said she wanted to check the two bodies.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa oba-san, who decided that we wouldn't make any more progress even if we asked any more, concluded her questioning and said that she wanted to check the two bodies.
PC Japanese (JP): これ以上は何を聞いても埒が明かないだろうと判断した楼座叔母さんは、それで切り上げ、二人の遺体を確認したいと言った。
Russian (RU): Тётя Роза, наконец решившая, что мы больше ничего не добьёмся, даже если продолжим расспрашивать и дальше, закончила допрос, и сказала, что ей нужно осмотреть те два тела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Rosa, tendo decidido que não conseguiria mais nada deles, concluiu a sua questão, e disse que queria checar os dois corpos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 認為再怎麼問也不會有進展的樓座姑母，就此打住了話題，提出了想去查看下兩人的遺體。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 认为再怎么问也不会有进展的楼座姑母，就此打住了话题，提出了想去查看下两人的遗体。
Italian (IT): Constatando che non avremmo fatto alcun progresso se avessimo domandato loro altro, zia Rosa terminò la conversazione, e comunicò di voler controllare i due cadaveri.
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze, onlardan daha fazla bir şey öğrenemeyeceğine karar verince sorgulamayı bıraktı, ve iki cesedi kontrol etmek istediğini söyledi.

Umineko Project (UP): I was also interested in that.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也是我所關心的。

Turkish (TR): Bununla ben de ilgileniyordum.

Umineko Project (UP): Even if these people didn't have a clue what was going on in their confusion, ...if those of us who hadn't been at the scene calmly looked at the bodies, we might find something.
Steam (ST): The witnesses had been unable to figure anything out, but they'd been shaken. ...If those of us who hadn't been at the scene calmly looked at the corpses, we might find something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even if these people didn't have a clue what was going on in their confusion, ...if those of us who hadn't been at the scene calmly looked at the corpses, we might find something.
PC Japanese (JP): 混乱した彼らには何が何だかわからなくても、…その現場に居合わせなかった俺たちは冷静に遺体を見て、何かを気がつけるかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Даже если эти люди ничего не поняли, поскольку запутались... То те из нас, кто спокойно осмотрит трупы, смогут что‐нибудь обнаружить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo que eles não tivessem ideia do que havia acontecido em meio à confusão deles, ...se nós, que não estávamos na cena, olhássemos calmamente os cadáveres, poderíamos encontrar algo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 即便腦中一片混亂的他們搞不清是怎麼回事，…讓當時沒在現場的我們去冷靜地查看一番，說不定也會有些發現。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 即便脑中一片混乱的他们搞不清是怎么回事，…让当时没在现场的我们去冷静地查看一番，说不定也会有些发现。
Italian (IT): Loro erano confusi e non avevano capito cosa fosse successo... ma noi, che non eravamo presenti alla scena del crimine, osservando i cadaveri con compostezza avremmo potuto notare qualcosa.
Turkish (TR): Bu insanların kafa karışıklığı içinde neler olup bittiğine dair en ufak bir fikirleri olmasa bile, ...eğer olay yerinde olmayan bizler sakin bir şekilde cesetlere bakarsak, bir şeyler bulabilirdik.

Umineko Project (UP): .........But it was a little surprising that Auntie Rosa was also concerned about the bodies, just like I was.
Steam (ST): ......But it was a little surprising to learn that Aunt Rosa was also concerned about the bodies.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........But it was a little surprising that Rosa oba-san was also concerned about the bodies, just like I was.
PC Japanese (JP): ………しかし、楼座叔母さんもまた、俺と同様に遺体が気になるのは少しだけ意外だった。
Russian (RU): .........Но было немного удивительно, что тётя Роза подумала о трупах, как и я.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Mas era um pouco surpreendente que a tia Rosa estivesse preocupada com os cadáveres, assim como eu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………不過，樓座姑母也和我同樣在意遺體，使我稍感意外。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………不过，楼座姑母也和我同样在意遗体，使我稍感意外。
Italian (IT): Tuttavia, ero leggermente stupito dal fatto che anche zia Rosa aveva rivolto la sua attenzione verso i cadaveri.
Turkish (TR): .........Ama Rosa Teyze'nin de tıpkı benim gibi cesetler konusunda endişeli olması biraz şaşırtıcıydı.

Umineko Project (UP): Even at this point, I still wanted to expose the culprit and the truth myself, if we could find any clues.
Steam (ST): Even at this point, I still wanted to use any clues I could find to expose the culprit and the truth myself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even at this point, I still wanted to expose the culprit and the truth myself, if we could find any clues.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はこの期に及んでも、何かの手掛かりがあれば、犯人や真相をこの手で暴いてやりたいと思っている。
Russian (RU): Даже в такой момент я всё ещё хотел самостоятельно выявить преступника, если мы обнаружим какие‐нибудь подсказки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo nesse ponto, eu ainda queria poder expor eu mesmo, o culpado e a verdade, se pudéssemos encontrar alguma pista.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我縱然到了這副田地，也還是在想著，一旦發現了線索，就去親手找出真相與犯人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我纵然到了这副田地，也还是在想着，一旦发现了线索，就去亲手找出真相与犯人。
Italian (IT): Anche in un momento del genere, volevo scoprire con le mie forze la verità sugli eventi e sul colpevole, nel caso ci fossero stati degli indizi.
Turkish (TR): Bu noktada bile, eğer herhangi bir ipucu bulabilirsek, suçluyu ve gerçeği kendim ortaya çıkarmak istiyordum.

Umineko Project (UP): But Auntie Rosa should have been different. ......Hadn't Auntie Rosa's plan given a higher priority to staying safe than to finding the culprit?
Steam (ST): But it should've been different in Aunt Rosa's case. ...Hasn't Aunt Rosa prioritized staying safe over finding the culprit?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But Rosa oba-san should have been different.......Hadn't Rosa oba-san's plan given a higher priority to staying safe than to finding the culprit?
PC Japanese (JP): しかし楼座叔母さんは違ったはずだ。……楼座叔母さんは確か、犯人探しよりも身の安全が最優先の方針だったはず。
Russian (RU): Но тётя Роза могла думать иначе. ......Разве план тёти Розы не ставил на первое место безопасность, чем поиск самого преступника?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas a tia Rosa faria de outro modo. ......Ela não havia planejado dar uma maior prioridade à nossa segurança do que à busca pelo culpado?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，樓座姑母應該與我是不同的。……我記得，比起找犯人，樓座姑母理應是把保護自身安全作為了最為優先的方針。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，楼座姑母应该与我是不同的。……我记得，比起找犯人，楼座姑母理应是把保护自身安全作为了最为优先的方针。
Italian (IT): Ma zia Rosa doveva avere altro in mente... La sua massima priorità non era quella di mantenere tutti al sicuro, invece di cercare il colpevole?
Turkish (TR): Ama Rosa Teyze'nin durumu farklı olmalıydı. ......Rosa Teyze'nin planında güvende kalmak, suçluyu bulmaktan daha öncelikli değil miydi?

Umineko Project (UP): I couldn't really see why Auntie Rosa wanted to check the bodies so badly that she would deliberately leave our fort in the parlor.
Steam (ST): I couldn't really see why she would go to all the trouble of leaving our barricade in the parlor, just because she wanted to check the bodies.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I couldn't really see why Rosa oba-san would go to all the trouble of leaving our barricade in the parlor because she wanted to check the bodies.
PC Japanese (JP): その楼座叔母さんが、わざわざ篭城の客間を出てまで遺体を確認したい理由が少し見えなかった。
Russian (RU): Я действительно не понимал, почему тётя Роза готова рискнуть, покидая наше убежище в гостиной из‐за того, что ей захотелось проверить тела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não consegui ver o motivo da tia Rosa querer checar os cadáveres com tanta determinação, a ponto de deliberadamente nos deixar sozinhos na sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我有些看不出這樣的樓座姑母，寧可離開籠城堅守的客廳，也要去查看遺體的理由。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我有些看不出这样的楼座姑母，宁可离开笼城坚守的客厅，也要去查看遗体的理由。
Italian (IT): Non riuscivo minimamente a capire il motivo per cui si era presa così tanta briga di esaminare i corpi, al punto da lasciare il rifugio nel salotto.
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze'nin salondaki bu kalemizi neden bilinçli olarak terk edecek kadar cesetleri kontrol etme isteği duyduğunu anlayamıyordum.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "We will all go to the servant room together. If we all move together, it'll be safe. Maria, stop that scribbling now!"
Steam (ST): "We will all go to the servant room together. If we all move together, it'll be safe. Maria, stop playing with scribbles!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "We will all go to the servant room together. If we all move together, it'll be safe. Maria, stop playing with scribbles!"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that George-aniki was against the idea of bringing Maria to the bloody crime scene.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que o George‐aniki estava resistindo em levar a Maria junto até a sangrenta cena do crime.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治大哥似乎有點反對，要把真里亞也一起帶去充滿血腥味的犯罪現場。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治大哥似乎有点反对，要把真里亚也一起带去充满血腥味的犯罪现场。

Turkish (TR): George-aniki'nin Maria'yı kanlı suç mahalline getirmeye biraz direndiği anlaşılıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...But taking into consideration the fact that Maria would be left alone here, it would surely be much safer if we took Maria with us.
Steam (ST): ...But considering that Maria would be all alone if left here, it'd surely be much safer to take Maria with us.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …だが、真里亞だけ残していくことを考えたら、一緒に連れて行く方がはるかに安全に違いない。
Russian (RU): ...Но учитывая тот факт, что Марию нельзя было оставлять здесь одну, взять её с собой было гораздо безопасней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas levando em consideração que a Maria ficaria sozinha aqui, certamente seria melhor levar a Maria junto conosco.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過一想便知，把真里亞一起帶走，遠比把她一個人留下來要安全得多。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过一想便知，把真里亚一起带走，远比把她一个人留下来要安全得多。
Italian (IT): Ma se si prendeva in considerazione il fatto che Maria sarebbe rimasta da sola, sarebbe stato decisamente più sicuro farla venire con noi...
Turkish (TR): ...Fakat Maria'nın burada yalnız kalacağı gerçeğini göz önünde bulundurursak, Maria'yı yanımıza almamız kesinlikle çok daha güvenli olacaktır.

Umineko Project (UP): ......In the end, it was just Aniki's irresponsible humanism.{n}We decided that all of us, including Maria, would go to the servant room.
Steam (ST): ...In the end, it was just Aniki's irresponsible humanism. We decided that all of us, including Maria, would go to the servant room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In the end, it was just Aniki's irresponsible humanism. We decided that all of us, including Maria, would go to the servant room.
PC Japanese (JP): ……結局、兄貴の無責任なヒューマニズムってことになる。俺たちは真里亞も含め、全員で使用人室へ行くことになった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……結局、兄貴の無責任なヒューマニズムってことになる。{n}俺たちは真里亞も含め、全員で使用人室へ行くことになった。
Russian (RU): ......В конце концов, это был лишь безответственный гуманизм Аники.{n}Мы решили, что все мы, включая Марию, отправимся в комнату прислуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......No fim, era apenas a irresponsabilidade humanista do aniki.{n}Nós decidimos que todos nós, incluindo a Maria, iríamos até a sala dos serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……最終，這只是成為了大哥不負責任的人道主義愚見。{n}我們決定了所有人——也包括真里亞在內，一同前往傭人室。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……最终，这只是成为了大哥不负责任的人道主义愚见。{n}我们决定了所有人——也包括真里亚在内，一同前往佣人室。
Italian (IT): In fin dei conti, quello del fratellone era stato un pietismo incosciente.{n}Decidemmo che tutti noi, Maria inclusa, saremmo andati nella stanza per i domestici.
Turkish (TR): ......Nihayetinde, bu sadece Aniki'nin düşüncesiz hümanizmiydi.{n}Hepimiz, Maria da dahil olmak üzere, hizmetkâr odasına gitmeye karar verdik.

Steam (ST): The bed in the servant room was stained with bright-red blood.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傭人室的床，染上了通紅的血。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 佣人室的床，染上了通红的血。
Italian (IT): Il letto della stanza per i domestici era imbrattato di sangue rosso cremisi...
Turkish (TR): Hizmetkâr odasındaki yatak kıpkırmızı kanla kaplanmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...No, not just the bed. The whole room was covered with a gruesome paint from countless blood stains.
Steam (ST): ...No, not just the bed. The whole room was covered with a gruesome paint from countless blood stains.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Não, não só na cama. A sala inteira estava coberta por uma pintura horrível de incontáveis poças de sangue.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不，不只是床。房間中被大量的血跡，塗抹上了淒慘的裝扮。

Turkish (TR): ...Hayır, sadece yatak değil. Odanın tamamı sayısız kan lekesinden oluşan korkunç bir renk tonuyla kaplıydı.

Umineko Project (UP): That dreadful scene alone was enough to give us an idea of the repulsive sight they had been trying to describe...

Russian (RU): "*Хи‐хи*хи‐хи*. Ты довольно быстро пришел к этому выводу, используя комнату Джессики в качестве предпосылки. Таким образом, можно создать закрытую комнату и без помощи магии. Тебя устроят три балла? Однако есть кое‐что более интересное... Есть кое‐что, о чём тебе никак нельзя забывать, верно?"

No entanto, a coisa realmente fascinante é que... há algo que você não pode esquecer."

Umineko Project (UP): On the one hand, there's the frontal attack, where she tries to force me to believe in witches, using locked room tricks that only a witch could do.
Steam (ST): On the one hand, there's the frontal attack, where she tries to force me to believe there's a witch using closed room tricks that only a witch could do.

PC Japanese (JP): 一つは、魔女にしかできない密室トリックで、俺に魔女を無理やり信じさせようとする力技のような正攻法。
Russian (RU): С одной стороны, это была атака в лоб, которой она пыталась заставить меня поверить, что был использован трюк с закрытой комнатой, который под силу лишь ведьме.

Turkish (TR): Bir yandan, sadece bir cadının yapabileceği kilitli oda numaralarını kullanarak, beni cadılara inanmaya zorlamaya çalıştığı, bir önden saldırı var.

Umineko Project (UP): ......And on the other hand, there's the rear attack, where she tries to lure me into thinking it would be better if there was a witch, by strengthening my suspicions of those close to me.

Russian (RU): ......И с другой стороны, это была атака с тыла, которой она вынуждала меня думать, что если ведьма отрицается, то это бросает подозрения на близких мне людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......De outro lado, tem um ataque pelas costas, onde ela tenta me induzir a pensar que seria melhor se ela fosse uma bruxa, fortalecendo as suspeitas de pessoas próximas a mim.

Italian (IT): ...E dall'altra c'è l'attacco dalle retrovie in cui, rafforzando i sospetti che avevo nei confronti dei miei cari, cerca di indurmi a pensare che sarebbe stato meglio credere che ci fosse una strega...

Umineko Project (UP): "*cackle*cackle*. The frontal attack is indispensable. ...The rear attack only has meaning because it advances at the same time as the frontal attack. Umineko Project (UP): {e:070:―People of the Ushiromiya family.{n}I wonder if your attempts at solving the epitaph's riddle for the gold are reaching a climax.{n}Solving the riddle of the epitaph is the single method by which you all can stop me.}
Steam (ST): {e:070:Members of the Ushiromiya Family and its household.{n}Have you now reached the climax of the riddle of the gold's epitaph?{n}There is only one way you all can stop me: by solving the epitaph's riddle.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 'Everyone of the Ushiromiya family.{n} I wonder if you have finally reached a climax solving the epitaph's riddle for the gold.{n} The only way you all can stop me is by solving the riddle of the epitaph.
PC Japanese (JP): {e:070:“右代宮家の皆様。{n}黄金の碑文の謎解きはいよいよ佳境に入りましたでしょうか。{n}皆さんに私を止めることができる唯一の方法が、碑文の謎を解くことなのです。}
Russian (RU): {e:070:{i:“Представители семьи Уширомия.}{n}{i:Мне интересно, подходят ли ваши попытки найти ответ на загадку золота эпитафии к кульминации.}{n}{i:Разгадать загадку эпитафии — это единственный способ остановить меня.}}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {e:070:―Membros da família Ushiromiya.{n}Eu me pergunto se suas tentativas de resolver o enigma do epitáfio do ouro estão chegando ao seu clímax.{n}Resolver o enigma do epitáfio é o único método que vocês podem usar para me parar.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {e:070:「右代宮家的諸位。{n}黃金碑文之謎，諸位是否已經解得終入佳境了呢？{n}各位能阻止我的唯一方法，就是解開碑文之謎。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {e:070:「右代宫家的诸位。{n}黄金碑文之谜，诸位是否已经解得终入佳境了呢？{n}各位能阻止我的唯一方法，就是解开碑文之谜。}
Italian (IT): {e:070:―Signore e signori della famiglia Ushiromiya.{n}Mi domando se abbiate finalmente raggiunto un punto di svolta nella risoluzione dell'enigma dell'oro presente nell'epigrafe.{n}L'unico modo per riuscire a fermarmi è risolvere l'enigma dell'epigrafe.}
Turkish (TR): {e:070:—Ushiromiya ailesinin hanımefendileri ve beyefendileri.{n}Altın kitabesinin bilmecesini çözme çabalarınızın doruk noktasına ulaşıp ulaşmadığını merak ediyorum.{n}Kitabenin bilmecesini çözmek beni durdurabilmenizin tek yoludur.}

Umineko Project (UP): {e:070:You will not be able to stop me, or the ritual, by way of any other method of any kind.{n}I ask all of you that you take care not to mistake your goal.}
Steam (ST): {e:070:There are no other options left to you that will result in the suspension of my ceremony.{n}I humbly ask that you take care not to misunderstand your current situation.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter which other methods you use, you won't be able to stop the ritual and me.{n} Take care that you don't mistake everyone's goal. I'm counting on you.
PC Japanese (JP): {e:070:それ以外の如何なる方法を以ってしても、私と儀式を止めることはできません。{n}くれぐれも皆さんの目的をお間違いなきよう、よろしくお願い申し上げます。}
Russian (RU): {e:070:{i:Не важно, какие прочие методы вы будете использовать, вы не сможете остановить ни меня, ни ритуал.}{n}{i:Позаботьтесь о том, чтобы не ошибиться в своей цели. Я надеюсь на вас.}}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {e:070:Vocês não serão capazes de me parar, nem parar a cerimônia, por qualquer outro método.{n}Eu humildemente peço a vocês para não compreenderem erroneamente a atual situação.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {e:070:除此之外的任何方法，都是無法阻止我與儀式的。{n}還請各位萬萬不要搞錯目的。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {e:070:除此之外的任何方法，都是无法阻止我与仪式的。{n}还请各位万万不要搞错目的。}
Italian (IT): {e:070:Oltre a ciò, non esistono altri mezzi per poter frenare me e il mio rituale.{n}Conto su di voi affinché vi accertiate di non travisare il vostro obbiettivo.}
Turkish (TR): {e:070:Başka hiçbir yöntemle beni ya da ritüeli durduramazsınız.{n}Hepinizden amacınızı yanlış anlamamaya özen göstermenizi önemle rica ediyorum.}

Umineko Project (UP): {e:070:Attempting to search for me is useless.{n}Attempting to escape from me is useless.{n}Attempting to deny me is also—useless.{n}{n}—{f:5:Beatrice} the Golden.}

PC Japanese (JP): {e:070:私を探そうとも、無駄。{n}私から逃れようとも、無駄。{n}私を否定しようとも、無駄なのです。{n}{n}——黄金のベアトリーチェ。”}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {e:070:私を探そうとも、無駄。{n}私から逃れようとも、無駄。{n}私を否定しようとも、無駄なのです。{n}{n}――黄金のベアトリーチェ。”}

PC Japanese (JP): 「何を思いついたやら。良かろう、説明する。隠し扉とは、知らぬ人間が認識できぬ出入り口のことであろうが。そんなこと子どもでも知っておろう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「何を思いついたやら。良かろう、説明する。隠し扉とは、知らぬ人間が認識できぬ出入り口のことであろうが。そんなこと子どもでも知っておろう」
Russian (RU): "Что это ты задумал? Ну хорошо, я объясню тебе. Потайная дверь связана со входом или выходом, которые не признаются теми, кто не знает о них. Даже дети знают об этом."

Umineko Project (UP): And what I'd learned just now. These "hidden doors" the witch was talking about referred to things that made it possible to get into or out of the room.
Steam (ST): Now move from there to what I've just learned. That term, "hidden door", refers to things that make it possible to enter or leave a room.

Russian (RU): И что я сейчас узнал. Эти "потайные двери", упомянутые ведьмой, относились к вещам, позволяющим войти или выйти из комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E o que eu acabei de aprender. Essas "portas secretas" que a bruxa estava falando se referem a coisas que fazem ser impossível entrar ou sair do quarto.

Umineko Project (UP): ......In other words, things that didn't permit entry or exit to the outside, and also wouldn't be noticed by people who didn't know about them, wouldn't fall under the definition of "hidden door".
Steam (ST): ...In other words, that category doesn't cover things that don't actually lead in or out of the room, even if these things could never be recognized by people who didn't know about them beforehand.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em outras palavras, coisas que não permitem a entrada, e nem a saída, e também que não são notadas por pessoas que não sabem sobre elas, que não sabem sobre a definição de uma "porta secreta".

Turkish (TR): ......Başka bir deyişle, dışarıya giriş çıkışa izin vermeyen, ve bunları bilmeyen insanlar tarafından da fark edilmeyecek şeyler "gizli kapı" tanımına girmezdi.

PC Japanese (JP): 「…しかしッ、……せめて紗音さんだけでも信じていただくわけには参りませんか…？！　彼女は、１０年間も右代宮家に奉仕を捧げてまいりました…！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…しかしッ、……せめて紗音さんだけでも信じていただくわけには参りませんか…？！　彼女は、１０年間も右代宮家に奉仕を捧げてまいりました…！」
Russian (RU): "...Однако... по крайней мере вы могли бы поверить Шаннон‐сан?! Она пожертвовала полновесными десятью годами службы в семье Уширомия!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Entretanto, ......você não pode ao menos acreditar na Shannon‐san...?! Ela dedicou dez anos inteiros de sua vida servindo à família Ushiromiya...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…但是，……可否請您至少光是相信一下紗音呢…？！她為右代宮家獻身服務都已有十年了…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…但是，……可否请您至少光是相信一下纱音呢…？！她为右代宫家献身服务都已有十年了…！」
Italian (IT): "Tuttavia... non potrebbe quantomeno credere a Shannon-san...?! La ragazza ha dedicato ben dieci anni del suo lavoro alla famiglia Ushiromiya...!"
Turkish (TR): "...Ancak, ......en azından Shannon-san'a inanamaz mısınız...?! O, tam on yılını Ushiromiya ailesine hizmet etmeye adadı...!"

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "I'm not telling you to believe me...! At the very least, would you at least believe Shannon‐san...?!!"
Steam (ST): I'm not telling you to believe me...! At the very least, can't you believe in Shannon-san...?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm not telling you to believe me...! At the very least, would you at least believe Shannon-san...?!!"
PC Japanese (JP): この郷田を信じろとは申しません…！　せめてッ、紗音さんだけでも信じてやっていただくわけには参りませんか…！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この郷田を信じろとは申しません…！　せめてッ、紗音さんだけでも信じてやっていただくわけには参りませんか…！！」
Russian (RU): "Я не прошу, чтобы вы поверили мне!.. Но хотя бы, по крайней мере, не могли бы вы поверить Шаннон‐сан?!"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …しかし、……もう、俺にもわからないッ！！{n}わからないんだッ！！

Steam (ST): Yeah, bit by bit, I'm starting to understand...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): ...It's {i:because} we've been searching an answer, ...that's why everything keeps going wrong...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's because we demanded an answer, ...that's why everything keeps getting stranger...

Turkish (TR): ......Çünkü bir cevap arıyoruz; ...bu yüzden her şey daha da garipleşiyor...

Umineko Project (UP): We don't need...an answer. These are all strange murders committed with bizarre magic by the 19th person, the witch {f:5:Beatrice}, as she follows a creepy ritual.
Steam (ST): We don't need...an answer. These are all...strange murders, committed with bizarre magic by the 19th person, the witch {f:5:Beatrice}, in accordance with some creepy ceremony.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We don't need, an answer. These are all, strange murders, committed with bizarre magic by the 19th person, the witch Beatrice, as she follows a creepy ceremony.
PC Japanese (JP): 答えなんか、いらない。全ては、１９人目の魔女ベアトリーチェが、不気味な儀式に則り、怪しげな魔法で犯した不思議な殺人。
Russian (RU): Мы не нуждаемся в ответе. Все эти странные убийства, совершены при помощи загадочной магии 19‐го человека, ведьмы {f:5:Беатриче}, поскольку она выполняет жуткую церемонию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós não precisamos...de uma resposta. Todos esses estranhos assassinatos cometidos com uma magia bizarra pela 19ª pessoa, a bruxa {f:5:Beatrice}, como se ela estivesse seguindo um ritual macabro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 根本，就不需要什麼答案。這一切，都是身為第十九人的魔女貝阿朵莉切，遵照恐怖的儀式，以怪異的魔法犯下的不可思議殺人事件。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 根本，就不需要什么答案。这一切，都是身为第十九人的魔女贝阿朵莉切，遵照恐怖的仪式，以怪异的魔法犯下的不可思议杀人事件。
Italian (IT): Non avevamo bisogno... di una risposta. Questi erano tutti dei misteriosi omicidi compiuti con strane magie dalla strega {f:5:Beatrice}, la 19ª persona, tutto secondo un rituale raccapricciante...
Turkish (TR): Bir cevaba...ihtiyacımız yok. Bunların hepsi 19. kişi olan cadı {f:5:Beatrice} tarafından, tüyler ürpertici bir ritüeli takip ederken, tuhaf büyülerle işlenen garip cinayetler.

Steam (ST): I don't...want to suspect...anyone anymore......

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon‐chan and Gohda‐san were protesting their innocence, half in tears.
Steam (ST): Shannon-chan and Gohda-san were protesting their innocence, half-crying.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon-chan and Gohda-san were protesting their innocence, half-crying.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "............Stop. ...What Rosa‐sama says is quite right. ...Until we find the corpses, {i:we cannot prove that Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa are innocent}."
Steam (ST): "......Enough. ...What Rosa-sama says is quite sensible. ...Until we find the corpses, {i:we cannot prove Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa's innocence}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Stop. ...What Rosa-sama says is quite right. ...Until we find the corpses, we cannot prove that Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa are innocent."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………よしなさい。…楼座さまの言うことはもっともだ。…死体を見つけない限り、{i:南條先生と熊沢の無実は証明できない}。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………よしなさい。…楼座さまの言うことはもっともだ。…死体を見つけない限り、{i:南條先生と熊沢の無実は証明できない}」
Russian (RU): "............Не стоит. ...Сказанное Розой‐сама совершенно верно. ...Пока мы не найдём трупы, {i:мы не сможем доказать, что доктор Нанджо и Кумасава невиновны}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Pare. ...O que a Rosa‐sama está dizendo é correto. ...Até encontrarmos os cadáveres, {i:não podemos provar que o doutor Nanjo e a Kumasawa são inocentes}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………夠了。…樓座夫人說的是最在理的。…只要沒找到屍體，{i:就無法證明南條大夫與熊澤的清白}。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………够了。…楼座夫人说的是最在理的。…只要没找到尸体，{i:就无法证明南条大夫与熊泽的清白}。」
Italian (IT): "...Smettetela... Quello che dice la signora Rosa è ragionevole... Finché non si troveranno i cadaveri, {i:non possiamo dimostrare l'innocenza del dottor Nanjo e di Kumasawa}."
Turkish (TR): "............Durun. ...Rosa-sama'nın söyledikleri çok doğru. ...Cesetleri bulana kadar, {i:Doktor Nanjo...ve Kumasawa'nın masum olduğunu...kanıtlayamayız}."

Umineko Project (UP): That's right. ......By Rosa‐san's argument, if the corpses could be found, then the innocence of at least those people could be proved.
Steam (ST): That's right. ...By Rosa-san's argument, if their corpses can be found, then the innocence of those people alone can be proven.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's right. ......By Rosa-san's argument, if the corpses could be found, then the innocence of only those people could be proved.
PC Japanese (JP): そうだ。……楼座さんの論法によるならば、死体が見付かればその人物の無実だけは証明できる。
Russian (RU): Так и есть. ......Согласно аргументу Розы‐сан, если трупы будут найдены, то невиновность этих людей будет доказана.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso mesmo. ......Pelo argumento da Rosa‐san, se os cadáveres forem encontrados, então ao menos a inocência de duas pessoas poderá ser provada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是啊。……按樓座姑母的邏輯，只要找到了屍體，就能證明此人的清白。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是啊。……按楼座姑母的逻辑，只要找到了尸体，就能证明此人的清白。
Italian (IT): Esatto... Secondo il ragionamento di Rosa-san, se i cadaveri fossero stati ritrovati, ciò sarebbe stata una dimostrazione della loro innocenza.
Turkish (TR): Bu doğru. ......Rosa-san'ın argümanına göre, cesetler bulunabilirse, en azından bu insanların masumiyeti kanıtlanabilirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): But only the people who were corpses. Even if they searched around the mansion and found the corpses, in the end, their own innocence would not be proved.
Steam (ST): But that only counted for the corpses. Even if the survivors searched the mansion and found the corpses, in the end, their own innocence would never be proven.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But only the people who were corpses. Even if they searched around the mansion and found the corpses, in the end, their own innocence would not be proved.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、死体の人物だけだ。彼らが屋敷内を探し回り、死体を見つけたとしても、結局、彼らの無実は証明されない。
Russian (RU): Но только людей, которые стали трупами. Даже если они будут искать по всему особняку и найдут трупы, то в итоге их собственная невиновность не будет доказана.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas apenas daqueles que se tornaram cadáveres. Mesmo se eles procurarem pela mansão e encontrarem os corpos, no fim, a própria inocência deles não vai ser provada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，這也只限於成為了屍體的人。就算他們幾個在大屋中四處搜尋，找到了屍體，其結果，也並不會證明他們的清白。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，这也只限于成为了尸体的人。就算他们几个在大屋中四处搜寻，找到了尸体，其结果，也并不会证明他们的清白。
Italian (IT): Ma solo per chi era un cadavere. Anche se avessero cercato per tutta la villa e avessero trovato i corpi, alla fine di tutto, l'innocenza dei restanti non sarebbe stata provata.
Turkish (TR): Ama bu sadece cesetler için geçerliydi. Malikanenin her tarafını arayıp cesetleri bulsalar bile, sonuçta kendi masumiyetleri kanıtlanamayacaktı.

Umineko Project (UP): They had abducted Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa‐san, killed them in another place, and locked the room with their own master keys.
Steam (ST): "They kidnapped Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa-san, killed them in another place, and locked the closed room with their own master keys."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They had kidnapped Doctor Nanjo and Kumasawa-san, killed them in another place, and locked the closed room with their own master keys.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles abduziram o doutor Nanjo e a Kumasawa‐san, os mataram em outro lugar, e trancaram o quarto com suas próprias chaves mestras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們把南條大夫與熊澤婆婆綁架到了別處，並殺害了兩人，而密室的門是用他們的總鑰匙鎖的——
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们把南条大夫与熊泽婆婆绑架到了别处，并杀害了两人，而密室的门是用他们的总钥匙锁的——

Umineko Project (UP): That's messed up!! Innocent if they die, guilty as long as they live, almost like a witch's trial!
Steam (ST): Isn't that strange?!! They're innocent if they die, but guilty as long as they're alive, just like a witch trial!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Isn't that strange?!! Innocent if they die, guilty as long as they are alive, almost like a witch's trial!
PC Japanese (JP): そんなのおかしいだろ！！　死ねば無罪、生きてる限り有罪なんて、まるで魔女裁判だ！
Russian (RU): Разве это не странно?! Невиновные, если умрут, виновные, пока живы. Почти как ведьмино испытание!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isto está uma bagunça!! Inocentes morrerem, enquanto culpados permanecerem vivos, quase como um julgamento da bruxa!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也太不正常了！！死了就無罪，只要還活著就是有罪什麼的，簡直就跟魔女審判一樣嘛！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这也太不正常了！！死了就无罪，只要还活着就是有罪什么的，简直就跟魔女审判一样嘛！

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Oh, right, the enemy's a witch. So everything's OK...?

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "......Rosa‐sama. We are furniture working for the Ushiromiya family. ......Whether we are trusted by you or not, that is not our concern. No matter what assessment you give us, we will only continue to serve until our final hour."
Steam (ST): "...Rosa-sama, we are furniture in service to the Ushiromiya family. ...Whether you trust us or not is no business of ours. No matter what assessment you give us, we will merely continue to serve until our final hour."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Rosa-sama. We are furniture who work for the Ushiromiya family. ......Whether we are trusted by you or not, that is not our concern. No matter what assessment you give us, we will only continue to serve until our final hour."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……楼座さま。私たちは右代宮家にお仕えする家具です。……私どもを信用されるもされないもまた、私どもの与り知ることではありません。たとえ、どのようなご評価をいただこうとも、最後の時までお勤めを続けるのみでございます。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……楼座さま。私たちは右代宮家にお仕えする家具です。……私どもを信用されるもされないもまた、私どもの与り知ることではありません。たとえ、どのようなご評価をいただこうとも、最後の時までお勤めを続けるのみでございます」
Russian (RU): "......Роза‐сама. Мы мебель, которая служит семье Уширомия. ......Доверяете ли вы нам или нет, это не наша забота. Неважно, как вы оцениваете нас, мы будем продолжать служить до нашего последнего часа."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Rosa‐sama. Nós somos mobílias que trabalham para a família Ushiromiya. ......Se você confia em nós ou não, isso não é de nossa preocupação. Não importa que tipo de avaliação você nos dê, nós iremos continuar servindo até nosso último momento."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……樓座夫人。我們是服務於右代宮家的家具。……我們受信任也好，不受信任也好，都是我們不該過問之事。無論得到什麼樣的評價，我們都只需盡責到最後一刻。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……楼座夫人。我们是服务于右代宫家的家具。……我们受信任也好，不受信任也好，都是我们不该过问之事。无论得到什么样的评价，我们都只需尽责到最后一刻。」
Italian (IT): "...Signora Rosa. Noi siamo mobili al servizio della famiglia Ushiromiya... Che noi godiamo o meno della fiducia altrui, non è cosa che ci riguarda. Noi ci limiteremo a proseguire nel nostro operato fino alla fine, e le opinioni nei nostri confronti non hanno alcuna rilevanza."
Turkish (TR): "......Rosa-sama. Bizler Ushiromiya ailesi için çalışan mobilyalarız. ......Sizin tarafınızdan güvenilip güvenilmediğimiz, bizi ilgilendirmeyen bir konudur. Bize nasıl bir değer biçerseniz biçin, son anlarımıza kadar hizmet etmeye devam edeceğiz."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "You really are a model servant. ...I truly understand why Father trusts you. It is truly heartrending that I must suspect even you."
Steam (ST): "You really are a model servant. ...I deeply understand why Father trusts you. It really is heartrending that I must suspect even you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あなたは本当に使用人の鑑ね。…お父様が心を許すのもよくわかるわ。そんなあなたまで疑わなくてはならないなんて、本当に心苦しいわ」
Russian (RU): "Ты действительно образцовый слуга. ...Я прекрасно понимаю, почему отец доверял тебе. Мне действительно очень больно, что приходится подозревать даже тебя."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): ".................. ......That's good judgment. Those master keys are the greatest basis upon which you have been suspected several times today. Relinquishing them in order to clear away that suspicion may only be a first step, but, well, I think it isn't a bad start."
Steam (ST): "......... ...That's a good decision. Those master keys are the main reason you've been suspected several times today. It may seem elementary that letting go of those might clear away that suspicion, but I don't think it's a bad thing."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".....................That's a good judgment. Those master keys are the greatest basis upon which you have been suspected several times today. It may seem elementary that letting go of those might clear away that suspicion, but, sorry, it won't."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………。……それは良い判断ね。今日、何度もあなたたちが疑われてきた最大の根拠はこのマスターキーのせい。それを手放せば疑いが晴らせるのではないかというのは、初歩的ではあるけれど、まぁ、悪いことじゃないと思うわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………。……それは良い判断ね。今日、何度もあなたたちが疑われてきた最大の根拠はこのマスターキー。それを手放せば疑いが晴らせるのではないかというのは、初歩的ではあるけれど、まぁ、悪いことじゃないと思うわ」
Russian (RU): "............... ......Это вполне разумно. Эти универсальные ключи и есть то главное основание, из‐за которого вы сегодня несколько раз выступали в роли подозреваемых. Отдать их может показаться простым решением для рассеивания подозрений, но к сожалению это не пройдёт."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".................. ......Esse é um bom julgamento. Estas chaves são a maior base pela qual você se tornou suspeito diversas vezes hoje. Devolvê‐las para evitar qualquer suspeita pode ser apenas o primeiro passo, mas, bem, eu penso que não seja um mau começo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………。……這是個不錯的判斷。今天害你們多次受到懷疑的最大根據，就是這個總鑰匙。交出了它，也許就能洗清嫌疑的這一想法，雖說還很是初步，不過，我覺得倒也並不壞。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………。……这是个不错的判断。今天害你们多次受到怀疑的最大根据，就是这个总钥匙。交出了它，也许就能洗清嫌疑的这一想法，虽说还很是初步，不过，我觉得倒也并不坏。」
Italian (IT): "...Questa è un'ottima decisione. Questi passepartout sono la causa principale dei sospetti avuti oggi su di voi. Mi sembra elementare che rinunciarvici non eliminerà ogni dubbio, ma... Beh, sarebbe già qualcosa."
Turkish (TR): ".................. ......Bu iyi bir karar. Bugün defalarca şüpheli duruma düşmenizin en büyük sebebi bu master anahtarlar. Bu şüpheyi ortadan kaldırmak için onlardan vazgeçmek sadece ilk adım olabilir, ama bence kötü bir başlangıç değil."

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, this was proof that all of the servants' service until today had been negated, and even the final honor that they should have been permitted had been stripped from them...
Steam (ST): In other words, this was proof that all of the servants' service until today had been negated, with even the final honor they should have been permitted stripped from them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, this was proof that all of the servants' service until today had been negated, and even the final honor that they should have been permitted had been stripped from them...
PC Japanese (JP): それはつまり、使用人全員の、今日までの労を全て否定し、彼らに許されたはずの最後の名誉までを毟り取った証…。
Russian (RU): Другими словами, это было доказательством того, что вся выслуга прислуги к этому времени не имела значения, и даже последняя честь, которой они были достойны, была отнята у них...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, isso era uma prova que os serviços dos empregados até hoje foram negados, e mesmo em sua honra final aquilo que lhes seria permitido fora arrancado deles...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 而这也证明，全体佣人时至今日的所有功劳与苦劳，都被否定得一干二净，就连他们本应获许拥有的最后的名誉，也都遭到了剥夺…。
Italian (IT): In altre parole, era la dimostrazione del ripudio degli sforzi compiuti finora da tutti i domestici, ed erano perfino stati spogliati del prestigio finale che doveva essere loro concesso...
